This is a Superior Arms (www.superiorarms.com) S-15 Carbine .223 Rem./5.56x45mm. I own another Superior Arms AR that's identical to this one, and it is a fantastic rifle!

This particular rifle was acquired as part of another deal, so I have not fired it myself. But looking it over it appears to have been fired very little, maybe less than 200 rds. It is clean, in like-new condition. I would have thought it was new myself until I noticed the SLIGHT wear on the bolt carrier.

title: For Sale:  Barrett M82A1
postcontent:
The Model 82A1 fits into a regular sized carrying case. Although it’s transported as a disassembled upper and lower receiver, it can be ready to fire in under a minute. The scope remains mounted on the upper receiver, maintaining scope zero. the rifle’s M1913 optics rail has a 27 MOA taper to take full advantage of the scope’s elevation travel.Barrett BORS System:This constantly adapting ballistics computer puts science at your fingertips. From environmental factors to the angle of your rifle, BORS instantly takes care of the data work so you can focus on the task of putting lead on target.The Barrett Optical Ranging System (BORS) is an integrated ballistics computer that mounts directly on the riflescope and couples to the elevation knob. drawing from thousands of tables and taking into account a number of real-time external factors, it automatically gives the shooter the exact yardage at which a bullet will hit. In other words, it’s like having an army of ballisticians behind every shot.Once the distance to the target has been estimated, the computer can be put into action by simply turning the elevation knob until the LCD displays the target’s range.
Three internal sensors automatically calculate the ballistic solution. BORS compensates for temperature, change in barometric pressure and aiming at an upward or downward angle. BORS even determines if the rifle is canted.The BORS kit includes the proprietary Barrett Ballistic Software* that’s pre-programmed with a library selected by Barrett. It also includes a BORS data cable that allows the user to program custom loads on a personal computer and transfer them directly to BORS.No Trade and payment must be PayPal or Check..

title: For Sale:  Heckler & Koch USP .40 S&W Compact
postcontent:
Brand new in box, buy it now!! (NO MANUAL SAFETY/DECOCKING LEVER) The HK USP Compact is a small frame pistol capable of firing full power loads. Based on the full-size USP models, these handy pistols combine compact size with optimum effective shooting performance. USP Compacts are smaller and lighter than large frame USPs. The reduction in trigger reach and grip circumference increases concealability and enhances shooting ergonomics. Unlike some subcompact semiautomatic pistols that use a difficult to shoot "two-finger grip" frame, the USP Compact uses a narrow, full-hand grip frame with a choice of interchangeable extended or flush-fitting magazine floorplates. This makes the pistol easy to shoot without sacrificing concealability. Like their large frame predecessors, USP Compacts are designed with the demanding needs of the law enforcement and military shooters in mind. Using a modified linkless Browning-type action, the USP Compact is built to take the punishment of high-energy +P loads. To reduce the length of the slide and barrel on the USP Compact, the mechanical recoil reduction system found on large frame USPs has been replaced by a specially designed flat compression spring contained in the captive recoil spring assembly by a polymer absorber bushing. Service life is still engineered to exceed 20,000 rounds. Easy to shoot, simple to maintain; the USP Compact is a reliable, safe, accurate, and highly concealable pistol. Shipping to lower 48 only, Shipping $30.00 KNOW YOUR LOCAL AND STATE LAWS!!
NO TRADE

title: For Sale:  "Golcher" Kentucky Long Rifle (circa early to mid 1800's)
postcontent:
Own a unique piece of American history!

The term "longrifle" (or long rifle) refers to a type of rifle used by civilians and the military. It is characterized by an unusually long barrel, which is felt to be in large part a unique development of American rifles, and was uncommon in European rifles of the same period.

Kentucky long rifles played an intricate  part in American history. These rifles were known for their accuracy and were used in the Revolutionary war, War of 1812, Mexican American War & Civil War and the French Indian wars alike. Additionally, many were carried by early pioneers for hunting and protection.

This rifle is a one of a kind and has original hand carvings in the stock making this quite the conversation piece. It has the markings of "Golcher" and it's a 40-45 caliber

This is indeed a long rifle! At 5'2" long this antiquated percussion cap rifle will look great in your collection or above your fire place for that ultimate rustic look!

Please note: It reads the caliber at "300 blackout (7.62x35mm)" at the top of the page. For some reason I am unable to remove this?  the caliber of the gun mentioned above is 40-45 cal

Please call: REDACTED

title: For Sale:  BUFFALO-BARNES LEAD-FREE .45 Colt +P - 160 gr. Barnes TAC-XP 1200 fps - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
http://extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=305

This is a super high performance 45 GAP loading and gives the 45 GAP some serious muscle. The long-for-weight all copper Barnes bullet will penetrate deeply for such a light bullet and will give low recoil, which aids in fast follow-up shots. Expect roughly 12 to 14 inches of penetration in living flesh and bone.

This load utilizes a flash suppressed powder, which gives the shooter an important advantage as most shootings in the US occur in low light when the criminal element is most active. Firing to save your life in the dark is likely if you find yourself forced to fire at all. Blinding yourself with your first shot, leaves you very vulnerable.

As always, we have used real world pistols to generate our advertised velocities. We feel the industry wide duplicitous practice of using extra long laboratory barrels to determine advertised velocities is dishonest to the customer as he/she will not be able to reproduce such false high velocities in the real world, where it matters.

postcontent:
Up for sale is a German Sports Guns AK-47, imported through ATI (American Tactical Imports) chambered in .22LR
Comes with one 24 round magazine, and all wood furniture.

This thing is sweet, but unfortunately I'm in need of the money so I'm selling it for $400 firm!

GSG is the only company currently licensed by Mr. Mikhail Kalashnikov (Original inventor of the AK-47) to make functional firearms, and they take this reponsibility seriously.

These rifles function and disassemble almost exactly like the "big boy" 7.62x39 versions of these rifles, so they make great trainers/learners/backups. 

Not only is the 7.62 far more expensive than the .22lr cartridge, but at least locally for me .22LR is a lot easier to find.

I will throw in 100 rounds of HV .22LR with the AK at the full asking price of $400 firm!

title: For Sale/Trade:  Property Marked Colt 1911 made in 1918
location: Reno, Sparks, Carson City, Reno, Nevada
postcontent:
This is a US Property marked Colt 1911 that was made in 1918 and shipped to Bush Terminal in Brooklyn and subsequently issued to an Army Officer to carry in World War 1 in France. In 1932 when the military was transitioning to the M1911A1, an armory converted it to an A1 by replacing a handful of parts, the grips and milling the grooves in the trigger guard. The pistol went on to serve in WW2 and remained in military inventory until the end of the Korean War.

Asking $1500 or best offer. Some trades considered

title: For Sale:  Blackhawk Weapons Case
postcontent:
Selling my 34" Blackhawk Weapons Case. Purchased new a couple years ago and it has been sitting under the bed ever since minus one trip to Philson's last weekend. I literally have never even stored a rifle in it except for the trip last Sunday to Philson's for the day. Retails for $99.00 new. It is in perfect condition. All zippers, velcro, etc., are in new condition. The four velcro front pockets hold 30 round magazines easily and the other front zippered compartment is quite large. http://www.blackhawk.com/product/Rifle-Case,140,134.htm

I'm asking $50.00 for the case but as with everything in life it is negotiable. Like to keep it local here in the Greenville area.
